description: To carry out tree surgery - to crown reduce by 1.5m from height and 2m from lateral branches Two Oaks, T1 and T2 on map in G1 within TPO 792
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The oak trees within the rear garden of 9 Ravenscourt Close form part of a row of mature oaks
within the rear gardens of neighboring properties.
They can be seen from neighboring properties in Ravenscourt Close, the road on Ravenscourt Close
and public footpaths bordering the green space to the south. As a result they has moderate to high
Both trees appear to be in good condition. They have attractive crowns, particularly when viewed
for the publicly accessible green space to the rear of the property. The oaks can be seen publicly
from multiple angles and contribute as two of many oaks that form a row of trees between the rear
boundaries of Ravenscourt Close, and the green space.
The application is rejected as, in our view there is not a valid arboricultural reason for this work.
Reasons given state: 'helping to maintain a natural appearance and good health of the trees'. The
work proposed could potentially have the opposite effect - causing 'lions tailing' at the prunin
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
